Use try-catch for expected errors. Log with context. Return user-friendly messages. Monitor error rates. Have fallback plans.
1. Choose right chart type. 2. Label clearly. 3. Use consistent colors. 4. Show trends, not just data. 5. Tell a story.
1. Define hypothesis. 2. Set sample size. 3. Random assignment. 4. Run for statistical significance. 5. Analyze with confidence intervals.
Focus on results and actionable insights. Use data-driven language. Example: 'Our analysis shows 3 key opportunities to increase engagement by 40%.'
Awareness (Blog posts, Social). Consideration (Case studies, Webinars). Decision (Free trial, Demo). Retention (Onboarding, Support).
